issue.title: [Bug]: extensions pomdtr.excalidraw-editor-3.5.2-universal static resource net::ERR_ABORTED 401

labels.name: triage
labels.description: This issue needs to be triaged by a maintainer

issue.body:
### Is there an existing issue for this?

- [X] I have searched the existing issues

### OS/Web Information

- Web Browser: Chrome Ver-113.0.5672.126
- Local OS: windows11
- Remote OS: Centos7.6
- Remote Architecture: x86_64
- `code-server --version`: 4.14.1 5c199629305a0b935b4388b7db549f77eae82b5a with Code 1.79.2


### Steps to Reproduce

1. code-server --install-extension pomdtr.excalidraw-editor
2. run code-server
3. create file demo.excalidraw
4. open file demo.excalidraw
5. view browser console


### Expected

response 200  
excalidraw renders normally

### Actual

net::ERR_ABORTED 401  
excalidraw cannot be rendered

### Logs

browser console:  
```
Request URL:
https://vscode-remote+vscode-002emydomain-002etop.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/root/.local/share/code-server/extensions/pomdtr.excalidraw-editor-3.5.2-universal/public/static/js/main.7ef26bea.js
Request Method:
GET
Status Code:
401 (from service worker)
Referrer Policy:
strict-origin-when-cross-origin
```
```
Request URL:
https://vscode-remote+vscode-002emydomain-002etop.vscode-resource.vscode-cdn.net/root/.local/share/code-server/extensions/pomdtr.excalidraw-editor-3.5.2-universal/public/static/css/main.11acca1e.css
Request Method:
GET
Status Code:
401 (from service worker)
Referrer Policy:
strict-origin-when-cross-origin
```

### Screenshot/Video

_No response_

### Does this issue happen in VS Code or GitHub Codespaces?

- [X] I cannot reproduce this in VS Code.
- [X] I cannot reproduce this in GitHub Codespaces.

### Are you accessing code-server over HTTPS?

- [X] I am using HTTPS.

### Notes

_No response_

comment.body:
> setting
> 
> ```
> auth: none
> ```
> 
> solves the issue on latest code-server with the latest version of the extension code-server: `v4.18.0` Excalidraw `v3.6.1` on Debian `testing`

Yes, those two resources main.75859edd.js and main.11acca1e.css  
In my browser, these two resources 401.  

I tried to go over and change the settings `auth: none` . Still have bugs.  
code-server: `v4.18.0`  
Excalidraw `v3.6.1`  
on Rocky Linux release 9.1 (Blue Onyx)  

But interesting...  
I saw successful access to the resource the moment I restarted code-server.  Only once, a bug appears after refreshing  
To avoid caching, I tried to execute the browser in the sandbox, but it didn't work.

comment.body:
setting

```
auth: none
```

solves the issue on latest code-server with the latest version of the extension
code-server: v4.18.0
Excalidraw v3.6.1

issue.title: Open Workspace while another Workspace is open doesn't work.

milestone.title: On Deck - High Priority
milestone.description: These are issues that are ready to be added to a release milestone and higher priority than "On Deck".

issue.body:
<!--

Hi there! 👋

Thanks for reporting a bug. Please see https://github.com/cdr/code-server/blob/main/docs/FAQ.md#how-do-i-debug-issues-with-code-server and include any logging information relevant to the issue.

Please search for existing issues before filing, as they may contain additional information about the problem and descriptions of workarounds. Provide as much information as you can, so that we can reproduce the issue. Otherwise, we may not be able to help diagnose the problem, and may close the issue as unreproducible or incomplete. For visual defects, please include screenshots to help us understand the issue.
-->

## OS/Web Information

- Web Browser: Firefox 87.0
- Local OS: M1 Macbook Air, MacOS 11.2.3
- Remote OS: Ubuntu 20.04
- Remote Architecture: x64
- `code-server --version`: 3.9.2 109d2ce3247869eaeab67aa7e5423503ec9eb859

## Steps to Reproduce

1. Open and work on the workspace
2. Click menu bar left top corner -> File -> Open Workspace
3. Try to open

## Expected

<!-- What should happen? -->
New workspace should open

## Actual

<!-- What actually happens? -->
Nothing happens
and it also ___`cd..`s on the input area___ or ___says `Please select a file.`___

## Screenshot

<!-- Ideally provide a screenshot, gif, video or screenrecording -->
https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29011440/113875043-54c45e80-97f1-11eb-8706-fa14855950ef.mov



## Notes

<!-- If you can reproduce the issue on vanilla VS Code,
please file the issue at the VS Code repository instead. -->

This issue can be reproduced in VS Code: No  
At the video I attached has language that is not in English, but that is NOT why this happens.

comment.body:
I just tried setting up a `code-server` dev environment and was able to reproduce the basic issue.

I cloned the `code-server` git repo and then used a dev container to install the various tools and run through the steps to get everything built and launched (via `yarn watch`).

- In this first picture, I have opened up a workspace file in Firefox and have an empty Safari window open as well.
![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 12 47 00](https://github.com/coder/code-server/assets/129629/7ceef3a8-8580-4fb9-9870-be684768616e)

- In this second picture, I proceeded to open the same workspace file in Safari and then wait awhile for (or manually)  refresh the explorer in the Firefox window. The refresh never completes.
![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 12 50 53](https://github.com/coder/code-server/assets/129629/19c66b62-e055-4c77-ac6a-653662cb958f)

- In this final picture, I closed the Safari window, and during the next explorer refresh, the initial window seems to recover and become functional again.
![CleanShot 2023-10-25 at 12 51 44](https://github.com/coder/code-server/assets/129629/49bd3883-3ba9-4cb0-8b9a-715b162f990d)
